forum.name: updates
forum.description: find out what's new with anylad. feature announcements and bug fix info. thanks all!
forum.latestCommentText: im gonna miss it for sure

thread.title: Build Animations!

comments.text: Hi! Version 171.1 (you're on [version]) has a new button at the bottom backside of the Thing context dialog...
... click it to start an animation of this creation being constructed, part by part!
I hope this is entertaining & useful, and can also be used for making YouTube videos or gifs. Enjoy & feedback welcome!
i was wondering what it was, as a part of my arm disappears and i start to panic.. xd
the faster you do it, the more inaccurate it becomes. oer
oh interesting, thx. need to look into optimizing that. ps: it should only work for placements, need to fix if it's also working on e.g. arms :)
ps: does the position become inaccurate, or the timing?
position. don't worry, my arm was placed, though will try to do unplaced now.
Update 171.2: The Build Animation button will now only show in the Thing context menu when it's a placement (not e.g. for body attachments)! Thx Xau!
Reproduced the incorrect positions issue for fast timings, looking into it now!
Update 171.3: We fixed an issue with Build Animation positions becoming incorrect for very fast second durations! Thx Xau!
And Update 171.4: Build Animations are now properly cleared upon area transports!
the animations are still incorrect, i'm afraid.
problem: you can use the building animation to get to places you arent supposed to be able to by activating it on walls and just walking through
yeah you can walk through walls and doors and anything with this extremely easily. please add a toggle for this with the default being off
that or make it editor only.
we're working on a rights toggle today, thx everyone! xau, build animation position issue noted!
Xau, wasn't able to reproduce position issues, could you pls check again if it's still wrong in v171.6 (you're on [version]) and if so, describe the object & time used? Thx

thread.latestCommentText: Xau, wasn't able to reproduce position issues, could you pls check again if it's still wrong in v171.6 (you're on [version]) and if so, describe the object & time used? Thx
